website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering if you are looking for effortless style that pairs nicely with warm weather, but some may find the fit and comfort questionable, and the look too casual.
pros: Casual style that is easy to wear and looks good with pants and shorts
Fabric is light and airy, making them ideal for summertime
cons: The fit is snug, which may require ordering up in size
Sole is somewhat firm, which could be uncomfortable for some
They look a bit like house slippers

customer_reviews.title: this is my second purchase!! I returned the ...
customer_reviews.text: this is my second purchase!! I returned the first pair due to yellow stains all over them. I purchased a second pair the same day I received the first ones I received them today and these ones are covered in yellow stains as well!! VERY DISSAPOINTING BY FAR. cheap yes so I will try to was these ones to see if I can get them clean. the white will come with stains, I am unsure if the colored ones are stained.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sams

customer_reviews.title: One Size Small.
customer_reviews.text: So apparently, I have purchased Toms shoes before, not online, but in a store, Journey's to be exact. I'm a size 10 and when I tried them on in the store, the shoe fit perfectly with toe room and all. I ordered the light beige, size 10, and they fit a little too tight, honestly, like 9-9.5. Mind you, I wear socks with my Toms also. I did a side by side comparison between my old gray Toms and the new ones I received and the new ones were way smaller. The color is amazing and all, but sizing isn't right; highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Juan R.

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: They look really nice and feels good on your feet not like some cheap cloth shoes. I will buy another pair soon, black probably
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Super cute shoes!! But was a women's fit not a mans!
customer_reviews.text: Cute shoes but too small !!! I wear a size 12 in women 10 men. I ordered a ten in men .. and the box says 10 and men and the tag on the shoe says 10 and men but they are not 10 and men they are 10 in women !!... here is a picture of one of my TOMS 12 and women and my new TOMS 10 and men they should be almost the same size!! I got the eartwise slate color...so be aware when you buy these..love the shoes just too small!!
customer_reviews.author: Snowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Summer?  BUY THESE
customer_reviews.text: These have become my favorite summer shoes. I ha e pretty wide feet and usually wear a 10.5 but a 10 was tight at first but will stretch out in a couple hours of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Mao

customer_reviews.title: Well made shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is one cool shoe & delivery came earlier then I expected,
customer_reviews.author: jstreet

customer_reviews.title: Tom's Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are pretty well made and pretty comfortable. The main purpose of these shoes is help those people around the world that would contract a disease through their feet and this is preventable. I do not work for Tom's Shoes but if your buying these shoes to last you for years or rock climbing than they are not for you. Tom's Shoes rock!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: wtf
customer_reviews.text: Just order these shoes. I ordered size 14. The box says size 14 and in the box are size 12s. Very dissapointed. I am sending them back monday.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Falt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes I am on my second pair.Definitely would order them again and again love the shoes.Really comfortable, I would order them a size small because they do stretch out. DONT worry if they are tight at first they stretch out and are extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Mcgaughey

customer_reviews.title: ordered a 10. 5 and they were way too ...
customer_reviews.text: ordered a 10.5 and they were way too s m a l l and i am a 10.5 so what the h e c k
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, Can't last forever
customer_reviews.text: what can I say about Tom's? They great shoes with great comfort. Only drawback is they can't last forever or even 4 months. When worn alot, they do begin to fall apart. I still love them though. I just can't wear them everyday - all day.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hersh

customer_reviews.title: Toms
customer_reviews.text: No way are these worth the "retail price". I would give them 1 star if I had to buy them at retail price. If you can get them at a significantly lower than "retail" price, they are a good alternative to sandals. You can wear these in any situation where you'd wear sandals. At the price I got them for, they will make good cheap gifts. Extra bonus points to the manufacturer for giving shoes to children in Africa. I don't really think this should weigh into your purchasing decision, though, unless you're a hippie going for conspicuous consumption, in which case, these will probably go great with your toyota prius.
customer_reviews.author: some guy

customer_reviews.title: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had received my item on time and found they were too small. I had ordered the same size shoe i would buy in the store and when i got them i could barely walk with out them hurting. I contacted the seller many many times and i never got a response i still have the shoes and is now contacting Amazon itself! This is by far the worst customer service i have ever gotten and worst online transaction ever. I will not buy anything else from this company. This was my first and FINAL TIME.
customer_reviews.author: Princely Posh

customer_reviews.title: i would say it is a stupid design !
customer_reviews.text: 1- look to the shoes (specifically the ratio between width and length) and tell me : how many people in this world has their feet measured in these ratios ? 2- ugly shaped. i purchased it in the hope that it will be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Essam A. Gndelee

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would hate these shoes, since wearing shoes without socks has always bothered me. Makes my feet sweat. But not these. I was expecting a nasty stinky mess, especially on my big size 14 feet, but these things stay surprisingly aired out. I have only had them a couple of weeks, but they are damn comfy. They are certainly not high travel or hiking shoes, but for casual outings in a (sub)urban setting, they're really nice.
customer_reviews.author: sieg6529

customer_reviews.title: Right size, wrong person
customer_reviews.text: The title here clearly says "Toms MEN'S Classic Canvas Slip-On" and I bought them for a male friend who is a size 9 in men's. I received a size 9 but in WOMEN'S. I'm only giving two stars because it was in good condition and was authentic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Third World Quality
customer_reviews.text: At one point, this was actually a quite respectable product. The first few pairs I bought lasted several years. But there has been a dramatic decline and I found that, even with only occasional wear, they don't make it through a single season with both the cloth uppers and rubber soles rapidly disintegrating. The manufacturer should concern himself less with giving away shoes and more about selling decent merchandise.
customer_reviews.author: Illuminatus

customer_reviews.title: SAD!
customer_reviews.text: THESE ARE FAKE! I PURCHASED THEM IN A SIZE 8 AND 10 AND THE SIZE 10 WAS FOR SURE FAKE SO IM RETURNING BOTH. WATCH THE IMPRINT ON THE INSIDE OF THE FATES, THEY ARE FADED, THE INSOLE IS LIGHTER AND THE OVERALL FABRIC IS LIGHTER! SAD!
customer_reviews.author: Ajo

customer_reviews.title: Video Review!!!
customer_reviews.text: Video Review!!!Watch its unboxing and review video in HD on my Youtube channel: skyforce95
customer_reviews.author: skyforce95

customer_reviews.title: Not bad; one bit of advice
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are comfortable and look OK and all, and the fact that TOM'S donates a pair of shoes for each pair bought is cool. Like the ash pair for summer wear; have a few lighter pairs of shorts they look good with. One bit of advice: Buy TOM'S shoes one-half to a full size smaller than your normal shoe size. You'll save yourself the hassle of having to return them. And don't worry about them being too small -- they'l stretch out
customer_reviews.author: DBH

customer_reviews.title: great comfy shoes
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought Toms for our three person familial unit and we love them. The people writing about poor quality might have a defective pair, and you can tell by looking at them they're not made for heavy use. Are they overpriced? Yeah, unfortunately, but they're a concept more than just a shoe. Also you're paying for a trend. I'm looking into my second pair.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: My take on TOMS
customer_reviews.text: I finally bought my first pair of TOMS last week and must admit that I'm pleasantly surprised. While they do seem cheaply made, they are so comfortable! I had to try on a few pairs to find a good fit, which meant buying a half size smaller than what I usually wear. They were a tad bit too tight but have stretched some for a better fit. I don't wear socks with mine but instead, wear those no-show footies that feel like pantyhose (can't think of what they are called- maybe a liner or something?).
customer_reviews.author: crissycurry

customer_reviews.title: I get it now.
customer_reviews.text: I got the ash grey pair from Zumiez at my local small. I wanted to try some on in person so I would know what size to get when I order from Toms.com or here in the future. I had to try on a few different sizes, but ended up settling for a half-size down from what I usually wear. When you try them on, keep in mind that they're going to be almost uncomfortably tight. Give it time. I wore mine for a full day, then when I put them on the second day, they stretched enough so they slipped on my feet, and they're perfect. I feel like I'm getting away with something when I wear these.
customer_reviews.author: Randy McCaig

customer_reviews.title: Prized Crap!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn them 4 times for a total of two hours, the soles are already wearing down, the heels are thinning so much they look like most of my shoes that I wear all day for two years. The one shoe is already loosing it's shape so I doubt it will stay on much longer. Probably will have to throw them out in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: dba

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice canvas shoes. of course no support at all but that is to be expected
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: great shoes
customer_reviews.text: i really do like these shoes. They are comfy and lightweight. Perfect for casual strolls
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Jones

customer_reviews.title: amazing and durable
customer_reviews.text: i wore these on the lake in the desert and on the rough trails of the camp they are amazingly comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: kambiz roghanchi

customer_reviews.title: Worst shoe I've ever had :(
customer_reviews.text: Yes they look cool but definitely a waste of $60. I usually wear puma indoor soccer shoes, but this job I picked up said I couldn't wear pumas but I could wear Toms. So I that's why I got them. They are just really uncomfortable, it's like a piece of cloth glued to some foam. It's no wonder they give a free pair away, the cost to make these shoes has to be ridiculously low... I would guess $1 maybe less who knows?
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes!!! But Just a Word of Advice...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are a spectacular edition to my closet, but I just found out for every pair sold, TOMS donates a pair to an underprivileged child. That's why from now on, I'll make sure to only buy used pairs. No free rides from this American! #ROMNEYRYAN2012
customer_reviews.author: Regis Philbin

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy Tom's Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three pairs of Tom's shoes in the last 9 months and I was appalled by the shoddy construction and poor reliability. The last pair I wore only indoors. There were holes in them within four months. This is for $50 shoes??? Gimme a break. Tom's shoes is a gimmick.
customer_reviews.author: RickB

customer_reviews.title: made in china at probably $1 per pair
customer_reviews.text: Given one for free when you paid at leat $45 for a pair doesn't seem that generous. I think the one for one marketing concept is catchy, but at the end is not that generous. I rather give my money away in a more productive way.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Rodriguez-alvez

customer_reviews.title: I WANT TO BUY A PAIR
customer_reviews.text: I want to buy the black pair, but why are these not sold in size 6.5? none of the sizes come in it. Please, I want these!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: The founder of this company had been busy patting himself on the back with his Earth Day and philanthropic goodness. These shoes are made in China (negating the overblown price) and shipped over here on container ships. Doesn't really fit in with the laid-back image.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality - Fall Apart Quickly
customer_reviews.text: I wore these shoes skateboarding for 8 minutes and they quickly fell apart. After the second ollie, I already noticed three small holes that had torn open. By the fourth ollie, they had spread even wider and were now exposing my toes. Avoid these shoes - even if they give a free pair away, it's more like giving away a slap to the face to whoever gets these free shoes. Also, they run small.
customer_reviews.author: The MillersTop Contributor: Golf

product_meta.title: TOMS Canvas Men Classic Black 001001A07-BLK
product_meta.description:
Awww, yeah. We thought we knew the meaning of comfort, but TOMS' Classic Canvas slip-on schooled us. Its cool, casual upper has an elastic inset at the vamp and darts at the toe to add wearing ease to its padded footbed and cushioning rubber outsole. It'll be your new favorite.

TOMS Shoes was founded in 2006 by Blake Mycoskie. The shoe is a unique slip-on design comprised of clean lines and lightweight fabrics in vibrant colors and prints. TOMS was founded when Blake was inspired on a trip to Argentina by the traditional, rope-soled Argentine "alpargata." He was struck by the poverty and health issues of the country, and set out to reinvent the alpargata for the U.S. market, and in doing so to accomplish one goal: Making life more comfortable for those without shoes. To realize this purpose, Blake made a commitment to match every pair of TOMS purchased with a donation of a pair to a child in need. It's simple: If you buy a pair of TOMS, the company will give a pair to someone in need on your behalf. During its first year in business, TOMS sold 10,000 pairs of shoes, and Blake returned to Argentina to lead his first annual Shoe Drop during which he donated to the children who had inspired him. TOMS Shoes are now available in multiple colors and fabric combinations for men, women and a recently introduced line for children, aptly titled Tiny TOMS.
